page.title: 02The flora of Wharton Woods.
page.content: Trees found in the wood are Japanese Birch, American Fir, Ash, Beech English Oak, Cherry, Sweet Chestnut, Horse Chestnut, Spruce, Austrian Pine, Holly, Hazel, Willow, Elder, Birch, European Silver Birch Crab Apple, and Hawthorne. The rarest flower in the wood is the Blue Marsh Orchid. More common flowers and shrubs include: Red Campian, Dog Rose, Forget-Me-Not, Yellow Hawkweed, Honeysuckle and the White Campian. The gamekeeper dislikes spraying because it not only kills the plants which are a nuisanse,but also the rarer wild plants. He also tries to preserve shrubs and trees,such as the Wild Rose which many gamekeepers cut down.
